definitions.title: n.[m.]
definitions.body: distaff (etym. Dub.; perh., if meaning correct, fr. [[כשׁר]] (cf. Sta:§ 216 Lag:BN 182) = be straight, because it stands erect, De Str; SyrVer k4iyuwto0 industry; whence Targum [[כּוּשְׁרָא]], and likewise Targum [[כּוּנְשְׁרָא]], also Pr 3:8, (for Heb. [[שׁר]]), where Levy wirbelsäule, Str:ad loc. Jastr navel; but Str doubts etymological connexion with [[כישׁור]]);—only in [[יׇדֶיהָ שִׁלְּחָה בַכִּישׁוָֹר]] Pr 31:19 (‖:[[פָּֽלָךְ ]] whirl of spindle).—As above De Now Str RV SS al.; > Ki AW Thes RobGes whirl of spindle (AV spindle); vid. [[פֶּלֶךְ]].
